statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem}\\ \text{graphically. Minimise and maximise} \\ Z=5x+10y\text{ subject to the constraints}\\ x+2y \le 120, x+y \ge 60, x-2y\ge 0,\\ \text{and }(x , y) \ge 0.

step.context: \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?}
step.reason: \text{Within the positive x and y axes and }\\ \text{below } x+2y=120 \text{ and } x-2y=0\\ \text{but above }x+y=60 \\

step.context: \text{What is the value of the Minimum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?}
step.tex: \begin{align} \text{Corner Points}\qquad &Z=5x+10y \\ (40, 20) \qquad &400 \\ (60, 0) \qquad &300 \leftarrow\text{minimum} \\ (120, 0) \qquad &600 \\ (60, 40) \qquad &400 \end{align} \\ \text{Maximum 600 is at all points joining }\\ (60, 30) \text{ and } (120, 0)
step.reason: \text{Objective function }5x+10y\lt 600 \text{ and}\\ \text{constraint }x+2y=120\text{ are colinear and}\\ \text{through point of maximum }(120, 0).
